Balak, בָּלָק — 10/17/26

Torah: Numbers 22:39 - 23:12 (15)

Gospel: ? (?)

Passages

  • Torah: Numbers 22:39 - 23:12
  • Gospel: ?

Torah — Numbers 22:39 - 23:12

LEB translation

22:39 Balaam went with Balak, and they came to Kiriath-Huzoth.
22:40 And Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and he sent them to Balaam and to the princes who were with him.
22:41 And it happened, in the morning Balak took Balaam and took him up to Bamoth-Baal, and he saw from there the end of the nation.
23:1 Balaam’s Oracles Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me this: seven altars. And prepare for me this: seven bulls and seven rams.”
23:2 And Balak did just as Balaam spoke, and Balak offered Balaam a bull and a ram on the altar.
23:3 And Balaam said to Balak, “Station yourself at your burnt offering, and I will go; perhaps Yahweh will come to meet me, and whatever he shows me I will tell to you.” So he went to a barren height.
23:4 And God met with Balaam, and he said to him, “I have arranged seven altars, and I have offered a bull and a ram on the altar.”
23:5 Yahweh put a word in the mouth of Balaam and said, “Return to Balak, and you must speak thus.”
23:6 So he returned to him, and behold, he was standing beside his burnt offering, he and all the leaders of Moab.
23:7 And he lifted up his oracle and said, “From Aram Balak lead me, from the mountains of the east the king of Moab, ‘Go for me, curse Jacob, and go, denounce Israel.’
23:8 How can I curse whom God has not cursed, and how can I denounce whom Yahweh has not denounced?
23:9 Because from the top of the rocks I see him, from hilltops I watch him. Behold, a people who dwell alone, they do not consider themselves among the nations.
23:10 Who can count the dust of Jacob, or as a number the fourth part of Israel? Let my life die the death of an upright person, and let my end be like his!”
23:11 And Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I took you to curse my enemies, and look, you have surely blessed them!”
23:12 He answered and said, “Should I not speak what Yahweh puts in my mouth?”

NIRV translation

22:39 Then Balaam went with Balak to Kiriath Huzoth.
22:40 Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep. He gave some to Balaam. He also gave some to the princes who were with him.
22:41 The next morning Balak took Balaam up to Bamoth Baal. From there he saw part of the people of Israel.
23:1 Balaam’s First Message From God Balaam said to Balak, “Build me seven altars here. Prepare seven bulls and seven rams for me to sacrifice.”
23:2 Balak did just as Balaam said. The two of them offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
23:3 Then Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your offering. I’ll go and try to find out what the Lord wants me to do. Maybe he’ll come and meet with me. Then I’ll tell you what he says to me.” So Balaam went off to a bare hilltop.
23:4 God met with him there. Balaam said, “I’ve prepared seven altars. On each altar I’ve offered a bull and a ram.”
23:5 The Lord put a message in Balaam’s mouth. The Lord said, “Go back to Balak. Give him my message.”
23:6 So Balaam went back to him. He found Balak standing beside his offering. All of the princes of Moab were with him.
23:7 Then Balaam spoke the message he had received from God. He said, “Balak brought me from the land of Aram. The king of Moab sent for me from the mountains in the east. ‘Come,’ he said. ‘Put a curse on Jacob’s people for me. Come. Speak against Israel.’
23:8 But how can I put a curse on people God hasn’t cursed? How can I speak against people the Lord hasn’t spoken against?
23:9 I see them from the rocky peaks. I view them from the hills. I see a group of people who live by themselves. They don’t consider themselves to be one of the nations.
23:10 Jacob’s people are like the dust of the earth. Can dust be counted? Who can count even a fourth of the people of Israel? Let me die as godly people die. Let my death be like theirs!”
23:11 Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I brought you here to put a curse on my enemies! But all you have done is give them a blessing!”
23:12 He answered, “I have to speak only the words the Lord puts in my mouth.”

Gospel — ?

LEB translation

NIRV translation
